verses.kjv: Now it came to pass in the seventh month, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah the son of Elishama, of the seed royal, and the princes of the king, even ten men with him, came unto Gedaliah the son of Ahikam to Mizpah; and there they did eat bread together in Mizpah.
verses.ct: In the 7th month, Ishmael son of Nethaniah, son of Elishama, who was of royal descent and had been one of the king's officials, came to Gedaliah son of Ahikam at Mizpah. He brought 10 men with him, and they shared a meal together there in Mizpah.

verses.kjv: Then arose Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and the ten men that were with him, and smote Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan with the sword, and slew him, whom the king of Babylon had made governor over the land.
verses.ct: Then Ishmael son of Nethaniah and the 10 men with him got up and struck down Gedaliah son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan, with their swords, killing the man the king of Babylon had appointed as governor over the land.

verses.kjv: Ishmael also slew all the Jews that were with him, even with Gedaliah, at Mizpah, and the Chaldeans that were found there, and the men of war.
verses.ct: Ishmael also killed all the Judeans who were with Gedaliah at Mizpah, along with the Babylonian soldiers who were stationed there.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass the second day after he had slain Gedaliah, and no man knew it,
verses.ct: On the 2nd day after Gedaliah's murder, before anyone had found out about it,

verses.kjv: That there came certain from Shechem, from Shiloh, and from Samaria, even fourscore men, having their beards shaven, and their clothes rent, and having cut themselves, with offerings and incense in their hand, to bring them to the house of the LORD.
verses.ct: 80 men arrived from Shechem, Shiloh, and Samaria. They had shaved their beards, torn their clothes, and cut themselves as signs of mourning, and they were carrying grain offerings and incense to bring to the house of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And Ishmael the son of Nethaniah went forth from Mizpah to meet them, weeping all along as he went: and it came to pass, as he met them, he said unto them, Come to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam.
verses.ct: Ishmael son of Nethaniah went out from Mizpah to meet them, weeping as he walked. When he reached them, he said, "Come with me to Gedaliah son of Ahikam."

verses.kjv: And it was so, when they came into the midst of the city, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah slew them, and cast them into the midst of the pit, he, and the men that were with him.
verses.ct: But once they were inside the city, Ishmael son of Nethaniah and his men killed them and threw their bodies into a cistern.

verses.kjv: But ten men were found among them that said unto Ishmael, Slay us not: for we have treasures in the field, of wheat, and of barley, and of oil, and of honey. So he forbare, and slew them not among their brethren.
verses.ct: However, 10 of the men pleaded with Ishmael, "Don't kill us! We have hidden supplies out in the fields — wheat, barley, oil, and honey." So he held back and did not kill them along with the others.

verses.kjv: Now the pit wherein Ishmael had cast all the dead bodies of the men, whom he had slain because of Gedaliah, was it which Asa the king had made for fear of Baasha king of Israel: and Ishmael the son of Nethaniah filled it with them that were slain.
verses.ct: The cistern where Ishmael dumped all the bodies of the men he had killed was a large one that King Asa had dug as a defense against King Baasha of Israel. Ishmael son of Nethaniah filled it with the dead.

verses.kjv: Then Ishmael carried away captive all the residue of the people that were in Mizpah, even the king’s daughters, and all the people that remained in Mizpah, whom Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had committed to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam: and Ishmael the son of Nethaniah carried them away captive, and departed to go over to the Ammonites.
verses.ct: Then Ishmael took captive all the remaining people in Mizpah — including the king's daughters and everyone else who was there — the people that Nebuzaradan, the commander of the guard, had placed under Gedaliah son of Ahikam's care. Ishmael son of Nethaniah captured them and set out to cross over to the Ammonites.

verses.kjv: But when Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces that were with him, heard of all the evil that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah had done,
verses.ct: When Johanan son of Kareah and all the military commanders with him heard about everything Ishmael son of Nethaniah had done,

verses.kjv: Then they took all the men, and went to fight with Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and found him by the great waters that are in Gibeon.
verses.ct: they gathered all their men and went after Ishmael son of Nethaniah. They caught up with him at the large pool in Gibeon.

verses.kjv: Now it came to pass, that when all the people which were with Ishmael saw Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces that were with him, then they were glad.
verses.ct: When all the captives with Ishmael saw Johanan son of Kareah and the military commanders with him, they were overjoyed.

verses.kjv: So all the people that Ishmael had carried away captive from Mizpah cast about and returned, and went unto Johanan the son of Kareah.
verses.ct: All the people Ishmael had taken captive from Mizpah turned around and ran to join Johanan son of Kareah.

verses.kjv: But Ishmael the son of Nethaniah escaped from Johanan with eight men, and went to the Ammonites.
verses.ct: But Ishmael son of Nethaniah escaped from Johanan with 8 men and fled to the Ammonites.

verses.kjv: Then took Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces that were with him, all the remnant of the people whom he had recovered from Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, from Mizpah, after that he had slain Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, even mighty men of war, and the women, and the children, and the eunuchs, whom he had brought again from Gibeon:
verses.ct: Johanan son of Kareah and all the military commanders with him then took charge of all the survivors they had rescued from Ishmael son of Nethaniah at Mizpah — after Ishmael had killed Gedaliah son of Ahikam. These included soldiers, women, children, and court officials, whom Johanan had brought back from Gibeon.

verses.kjv: And they departed, and dwelt in the habitation of Chimham, which is by Bethlehem, to go to enter into Egypt,
verses.ct: They left and stayed at the settlement of Chimham near Bethlehem, intending to continue on to Egypt.

verses.kjv: Because of the Chaldeans: for they were afraid of them, because Ishmael the son of Nethaniah had slain Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, whom the king of Babylon made governor in the land.
verses.ct: They were afraid of the Babylonians because Ishmael son of Nethaniah had killed Gedaliah son of Ahikam, the man the king of Babylon had appointed as governor over the land.
